title: Is it true that Napoleon Bonaparte almost joined the Russian Army? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well it’s not impossible Napoleon�s Four Personal Requests Such facts which can in some extent illuminate the reasons of Napoleon’s persistent enminity to Russia are: Application of Sub-Lieutenant Napoleon Buonaparte to Russian service dated 1789 and rejected under the pretext of pretension of the applicant to major rank.Application of Lieutenant-Colonel Napoleon Buonaparte to Russian fleet and rejected under the same reason.Napoleon’s intention to marry Grand Princess Ekaterina Pavlovna (Alexander I’s sister) first diplomatically declined by Alexander and then finally rejected i.e. Grand Princess was immediately engaged by Prince of Oldenburg.Second Napoleon’s request to marry another Russian Grand Princess Anna Pavlovna, also rejected by Romanovs under the pretext of her age (she was only 15 years old).

Napoleon never almost joined the Russian Army. If the early 1790s, Bonaparte briefly considered joining the Ottoman Army, as he was invited by the Sultan to Constantinople to be an artillery instructor. Bonaparte saw the benefits of doing this, remarking that he could make a fortune there. However, he eventually decided against it.
